titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the D. Michael Fisher Papers, 1969-2004 AIS.2007.07
titlestmt.author: Bryce Henry.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:51:03 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The D. Michael Fisher Papers document the political career and senatorial, attorney general, and gubernatorial campaigns of Mike Fisher. The material in this collection includes information related to Pennsylvania political campaigns, such as consultant surveys, correspondence, financial information, issue files, news clippings, polling studies, press releases, research files, videos of commercials and debates.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Bryce Henry in Spring 2012.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: D. Michael Fisher Papers, 1969-2004, AIS.2007.07, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: D. Michael Fisher Papers, 1969-2004, AIS.2007.07, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is divided into nine series:
Series III. Attorney General's Office Insurance Fraud Investigation Report

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of D. Michael Fisher on October 4, 2007.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The D. Michael Fisher Papers comprises material created throughout Mike Fisher's political career including his tenure as Pennsylvania senator, attorney general, and governor. The materials are primarily focused on Fisher's campaigns though a small amount of information on his time in various political offices exists. There are no materials related to Fisher's time as a Representative and only one item from his judicial career.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Dennis Michael 'Mike' Fisher is a Federal Judge on the United States Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit. He was nominated by President George W. Bush on May 1, 2003 and confirmed by the Senate later that year. Fisher was born 1944 in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania to C. Francis and Dolores Darby Fisher. He is married to Carol Hudak Fisher and has two children, Michelle Lynn and Brett Michael. Mike Fisher studied at Georgetown University where he earned a bachelor's degree in 1966 and his law degree in 1969.

In 1969 Fisher was a law clerk in a private practice before becoming the Assistant District Attorney for the Allegheny County District Attorney's Office in 1970. In 1974 he successfully ran for Pennsylvania House of Representatives where he served until 1980. From 1980-1996 he was a member of the Pennsylvania Senate. In 1994 he made an unsuccessful bid for Governor, but lost the GOP nomination to Tom Ridge. In 1996 he was elected Attorney General of Pennsylvania, where he served two terms (1996-2003). In 2002 he gained the Republican nomination for Pennsylvania Governor running against Democratic candidate Ed Rendell. Though Fisher's bid for governor was ultimately unsuccessful he was nominated by President Bush to the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit in 2003.

During his tenure as attorney general, Fisher focused heavily on combating illegal drugs. His office made over 6,000 drug related arrests during Fisher's time in office. In 1999 Mike Fisher and eight other attorney generals negotiated a $206 billion settlement with the tobacco industry of which Pennsylvania received $11.3 billion.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Pennsylvania State Senate series is comprised of a small amount of materials related to Fisher's time as a senator (1980-1996). It includes information on his trip to the Republican National Convention in 1992; financial information, press releases, and news articles for his 1994 re-election campaign; and newspaper clippings related to his accomplishments as a Pennsylvania senator.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The 1992 Republican Nation Convention sub-series is comprised of materials from Mike Fisher's time as an RNC delegate for Bush/Quayle in 1992. It includes badges, a commemorative passport, Fisher's golf scorecard, and notes on Bill Clinton.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Materials in the 1994 Fisher for Senator Campaign sub-series include campaign financial reports, media reports and clippings, and information of the Ridge/Schweiker gubernatorial campaign. There is also a brochure for the failed 1986 Scranton/Fisher gubernatorial campaign - it is the only item in this collection related to Fisher's bid for leiutenant governor.

Fisher's campaign was managed by James C. Roddey -- former Port Authority Board Chairman, and then current Managing General Partner of Allegheny Media, later to become Pennsylvania's first County Executive -- who served as campaign chairman, and Gregory A. Harbaugh -- Allegheny Co. fundraiser for Bush presidential campaign and senior partner in Houston Harbaugh law firm -- who was campaign treasurer.

did.unittitle: Brochure from 1986 Bill Scranton for Governor, Mike Fisher for Lt. Governor campaign

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: 1 b/w headshot print of Fisher

did.unittitle: Tom Ridge for Governor Committee finances
Tom Ridge for Governor information book and Ridge/Schweiker campaign brochure

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Senate 1995 sub-series is comprised entirely of clippings from newspapers regarding the actions of Senator Fisher. These were likely assembled as material to boost Fisher's image in his 1996 bid for Attorney General.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The 1996 Attorney General Campaign documents the Fisher campaign and includes campaign analysis research, correspondence, event and fundraising information, newspaper clippings, and press materials. During the 1996 campaign season, Mike Fisher ran against Democratic candidate, Joseph Kohn; Fisher was successfully elected as the Attorney General of Pennsylvania.

The bulk of the in this series date from 1995-1996; unless otherwise noted, all files fall within this range. The most common date note is for specific dates, though occasionally materials fall well outside this range; see in particular the Opposition Research sub-series on Democratic attorney general nominee, Joseph C. Kohn.

did.unittitle: Clippings of Newspapers and Other Sources for Attorney General Candidates

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This sub-series is comprised of articles and news clippings related to Fisher and his opponents for Attorney General. The two largest folders are Fisher's and Mike Marino, the other Republican candidate.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Correspondence sub-series includes letters, memos, and other correspondence primarily from supporters, staff, constituents, and Republican or other interest groups. It also includes a letter from Mike Marino to Allegheny County Republican Chairman, Robert W. Cramer.

did.unittitle: County Chairs and State Committee letter draft
Opponents' correspondence -- contains only Mike Marino letter

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The County Files sub-series are comprised of materials related to Republican supporters in various Pennsylvania counties. They include correspondence with supporters and County Coordinators, Steering Committee and other membership lists, and event information and schedules

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Finances sub-series includes information on Fisher's campaign's fiscal status including expenses, contributions, and disbursements. It also includes a small amount of material on the campaign's financial plans and the Finance Committee generally.

did.unittitle: Statement of Cash Receipts and Disbursements

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Opposition Research on Joseph Kohn sub-series compiles research assembled by the Fisher campaign on 1992 and 1996 Democratic attorney general nominee, Joseph Kohn. This sub-series includes background investigations into Kohn's personal life as well as his legal and political career. Much of the material includes annotations or descriptions as to its utility for Fisher's campaign strategy.

did.unittitle: Background information on Kohn's legal career
Biographical, legal, and positional research on Joe Kohn
Kohn case research -- AIDS case, Doe v. Kohn et al
Kohn case research -- Amino Acid Lysine antitrust litigation
Kohn case research -- Air transportation antitrust suit
Kohn case research -- Centennial School District v. Independence Blue Cross
Kohn case research -- Cumberland Farms, Inc., et al. v. Browning-Ferris Industries, Inc.
Kohn case research -- The Department of Stripper Well exemption litigation
Kohn case research -- Scott Doe dockets
Kohn case research -- General Motors pickup truck fuel tank products liability litigation
Kohn case research -- J/H Real Estate, Inc. v. Leonard Abramson, et al.
Kohn case research -- Lutheran church RICO case
Kohn case research -- Mishel et al. v. Nutri/System, Inc., et al.
Kohn case research -- Paoli Railroad Yard PCB litigation
Kohn case research -- Parkway Garage, Inc. v. The City of Philadelphia
Kohn general research -- John Wasilchick's opposition research proposal and report
Press releases from Fisher campaign regarding Joseph Kohn

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Polling Research sub-series contains statistical research gathered from surveys of voters leading up to Fisher's election.

did.unittitle: Key Findings from a Survey of Voter Attitudes in the State of Pennsylvania
Key Findings from a Survey of Voter Attitudes in the State of Pennsylvania

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Press Releases sub-series consists of materials generated by the Fisher for Attorney General campaign to highlight Fisher's qualification as well as to introduce him and his positions.

did.unittitle: Biographical and background information about Mike Fisher
Positions taken by Fisher during campaign

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Includes Fisher's positions on: crime, environment, firearms, senior citizens, tobacco, and women's issues.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Subject Files sub-series is comprised of materials of which are too small to comprise their own groupings. As such it consists a range of material including campaign stickers, balloons, brochures, and other ephemera; debates; events and agendas for Fisher; general election results; instructional guides to campaign staffers; non-Attorney General candidate information; and Republican State Committee information.

did.unittitle: Fisher tailgate party for PSU/Iowa game
Joseph Kohn and D. Michael Fisher Bar Association debate transcript
Prime sponsor Bills of Fisher as a Senator and Representative
Republican State Committee delegates committed to Fisher
Sheriffs' party affiliations of counties in Pennsylvania
Bob Shuster for Congress campaign materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Trips and Travels sub-series documents Fisher's travels around Pennsylvania during the 1996 Attorney General Campaign.

did.unittitle: Attorney General's Office Insurance Fraud Investigation Report

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Attorney General's Office Insurance Fraud Investigation Report series comprises the only extant materials of Fisher's tenure as attorney general outside of campaign purposes. The three files of this series are taken from an April 1997 report and press release from the Office of Attorney General -- Criminal Law Division -- Bureau of Criminal Investigations -- Insurance Fraud Section. The report details twenty-six arrests broken into sections arranged by suspect's last name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The 2000 Attorney General Campaign series consists of materials for Mike Fisher's attention as the Attorney General candidate. It consists of campaign promotional materials, finance information, and campaign analysis reports.

did.unittitle: Finances -- Advertising and polling costs notebook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Sections: Schedule (empty); Fundraising; Account Balance (empty); and TV Buy.

did.unittitle: Finances -- Advertising and polling costs notebook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Sections: Results; Mail/Phones; Print ads; and Radio.

did.unittitle: Finances -- Advertising and polling costs notebook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Sections: Tracking; and Editorials

did.unittitle: Reports -- Brabender Cox -- Analysis of Fisher Print Media Coverage
Reports -- Tarrance Group -- Key Findings from a Statewide Survey of Voter Attitudes in Pennsylvania

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The materials in the 2002 Governor Campaign series comprise materials related to Fisher's 2002 gubernatorial campaign. Fisher was nominated as the Republican candidate, Jane Earll ran as Lieutenant Governor. Fisher ran against Ed Rendell, the Democratic nominee, in the primary election. Fisher's other opponents in the race included Bob Casey, Jr. and Barbara Hafer. Materials in this series include campaign memorabilia, correspondence, campaign finance information, press releases, research on campaign issues, news briefing packets, files of Fisher's opponents, and polling/survey research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Campaign Materials sub-series includes campaign advertisements, Fisher campaign staff information, and a file of organizations endorsing Fisher for Attorney General.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Correspondence sub-series is comprised of issue related correspondence from various constituents and organizations in Pennsylvania. Several pieces of correspondence relate to organizations seeking to endorse a candidate based on their political views and positions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Direct Mail Files sub-series documents the creation of form letters for events and individuals related to the Fisher campaign.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Donor Briefings sub-series consists of information generated by Fisher's staff concerning important donors to the Fisher campaign.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Finances sub-series is comprised of financial information of Fisher's gubernatorial campaign. It is divided into three sections: Fundraising Events, Major Donor Files, and Subject Files. The Fundraising Events includes event information, briefing memos to Mike Fisher, donation spreadsheets, and correspondence. The Major Donor Files are arranged alphabetically Abrams to Zimmerman; a given file will contain a briefing memorandum for Fisher, copies of the donation checks, and/or thank you notes. The Subject Files contains additional financial information that would not fit into other sections; these include campaign finance reports, a sampled selection of mail-in contributions, a list of pro-life donors, and Fisher's staff's salary information.
Check copies, invoices, and yes/no attendance cards have all been removed from this series.
Mike Fisher thank you notes have been sampled throughout. Notes with unique messages have been retained.

did.unittitle: Lunch with George Glatfelter II and Peter Yaffee
Hershey Entertainment and Resorts Company PAC
Mike Fisher dinner in Washington, DC
President Bush private reception thank you notes
Southeast Young Republican for Fisher luncheon - Reed Smith
Franklin Shoeneman home event, Schuykill County
Towanda fundraiser at Bradford County museum
The Honorable Lita and Stanley Cohen and Councilman Brian O'Neill fundraiser
Philadelphia roundtable with Mayor Rudolph Giuliani
Pittsburgh Westin Convention Center for November 5, 2002 election night
Fisher for Governor electronic files -- budget, briefings, donations, and event information
Fisher for Governor and Friends of Michael Fisher certified public accountant reports

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The DMF Political Career sub-series contains samples of Fisher's work throughout his political career. It includes a profile of his legislative record in the House and Senate; platform and opposition information from his initial gubernatorial campaign in 1994; and overview information and press releases from his time as Attorney General.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Issue Files sub-series is comprised of issues important to Fisher's campaign. They contain correspondence, news clips, press releases, reports, and other materials documenting his commitment to various campaign topics.

did.unittitle: Fisher and Earll biographies, profiles, and important campaign issues overview

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Includes briefings on: economy, education, property taxes, agriculture, environment, state liquor stores, water, prescription drugs, transportation, redevelopment, Ed Rendell, and Bob Casey.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Includes Fisher's positions on: economy/jobs in Pennsylvania, healthcare, and the environment.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Liquor Control Board (LCB) sub-series contains information related to Pennsylvania's Liquor Control Board and the state stores for alcohol contribution. It primarily contains Gov. Tom Ridge's materials and research on the privatization of the LCB and a small amount of information from Gov. Dick Thornburgh. These were likely research materials for Mike Fisher and his promise to privatize the LCB should he be elected governor (see, AIS.2007.07: Mike Fisher Papers, box 8, ff 1, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh).

did.unittitle: Governor Ridge -- LCB memorandum and correspondence
Governor Ridge -- LCB reports and presentations
Governor Ridge -- LCB statements, news releases, and liquor control information

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The News Clip Packets sub-series is almost comprised entirely of photocopied newspaper articles. Each folder contains several packets named by their latest date and followed by their inclusive dates. They are arranged by their most recent date, a bundle often encompass several days of news - often to track a particular story, politician, or issue. Several bundles begin with either an editorial cartoon or magazine article, and one (October 21) contains copies from the 2002 Pennsylvania Voters Guide.

Subject focus is on the campaign issues prominent during the end of the gubernatorial 2002 campaign including schools/education underperformance, gambling, attack ads, endorsements, fund raising, taxes, abortion, and guns. Subjects vary by bundle and they may have served as daily media briefings for Mike Fisher.

The Newslibrary Document Delivery materials are in regard to Ed Rendell's early political career, and despite originally being housed with the news clipping bundles their relation to the rest of this material is unknown.
Duplicate bundles have been removed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: All newsprint in this subseries are photocopied or printed, with the exception of folder 7: Loose newspapers and clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Many of these seem torn from or fallen out of the News Clipping Packets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Personal Information sub-series consists of tax and medical information about Mike Fisher and Jane Earll.

did.unittitle: Income tax return - Jane M. Earll and John H. Daneri
Income tax returns - D. Michael and Carol H. Fisher
Lt. Governor file - Jane Earll's bill of health, headshot, and various notes and clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Plans and Publications sub-series is comprised of information on the Fisher/Earll gubernatorial agendas including plans for improving education, jobs, and senior citizen's services. This sub-series also includes information on reducing crime rate in Pennsylvania.

did.unittitle: Attorney General Year in Review reports
Fisher/Earll coalition, education and jobs plans

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Ed Rendell Files sub-series is comprised of research conducted by the Fisher campaign into Ed Rendell's background and politics. It also includes detailed information on Rendell's campaign finance status.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Includes small amount of information on Bob Casey Jr. and Barbara Hafer's finances as well.

did.unittitle: Tom Ridge and Mark Schweiker Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Tom Ridge and Mark Schweiker Files sub-series consists of accomplishments, initiatives, and publications of outgoing governors Tom Ridge and Mark Schweiker. Schweiker, Ridge's lieutenant governor, became governor when Ridge resigned to become Homeland Security Adviser to George W. Bush in 2001.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Subject Files sub-series includes materials that did not fit into the other sub-series of the Mike Fisher for Governor series. These include a sampled selection of petitions, debate information, publications unrelated to the Fisher campaign, and a heavily marked directory for Seton-La Salle, Elizabeth Seton, South Hills Catholic High Schools.

did.unittitle: Briefing regarding National Association of Attorneys General (NAAG) multi-state report
Sampled petitions for Mike Fisher and Jane Earll with related correspondence
Seton-La Salle High School, Elizabeth Seton High School, and South Hills Catholic High School Alumni Directory

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Heavily bookmarked.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Tarrance Group Reports sub-series is comprised primarily of voter attitude surveys conducted by the Republican strategic research and polling consulting firm, The Tarrance Group. In addition to the voter surveys, there is a report with presentation slides analyzing the various gubernatorial candidates, but primarily focused on Mike Fisher, his campaign, and voter/newspaper perceptions of him and his political agenda.

did.unittitle: A Survey of Voter Attitudes in Pennsylvania
A Survey of Voter Attitudes in Pennsylvania
A Survey of Voter Attitudes in Pennsylvania

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Schedules of Events series comprises information on events that Fisher attended or was invited to. These files document when and where Fisher was during his gubernatorial campaign as well as the reasons he was there. Events include fundraisers, meet-and-greets, inaugurations, and other gatherings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Post-2002 File series contains the only two items in the D. Michael Fisher papers sub-group that date after 2002. Items are comprised of a calendar and Fisher's judicial installation ceremony pamphlet.

did.unittitle: Attorney General Mike Fisher's 2004 Drug-Free Calendar
U.S. Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit installation ceremony pamphlet for Mike Fisher

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Memorobilia series is comprised of various objects commemorating different events in Fisher's life. They include objects relating to Fisher's professional life, such as certificates of election to the House of Representatives, as well as items like commemorative pens from legislation he worked to pass. Also included in this subseries is the certificate confirming Fisher as a certified attorney, and awards from local groups for him personally. Includes various certificates of election or achievement, community acknowledgements, membership notices, and awards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Photographs series is comprised of slides and photographic prints of Mike Fisher's career, Kent Gates, and a variety of politicians posing alone or with Fisher/Gates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Attorney General photos sub-series are comprised of images of Fisher on the campaing trail.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Gubernatorial Campaign photos are comprised of images of Fisher on the campaing trail. Subjects include posing with his family, Jane Earll, and President Bush.

did.unittitle: Mike Fisher posing with Jane Earll
Mike Fisher with President George W. Bush

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The topical photos include images of Mike Fisher with various individuals and groups. The photos include both posed and candid shots of Fisher. Subjects include Fisher with family, students, the elderly, farmers, Jane Earll, industry workers, and Fisher speaking at a town hall style meeting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Undated Mike Fisher Photos sub-series includes photos of Fisher, Fisher golfing, Fisher's family, and Fisher with others (including politicians and other influential people) from various periods throughout Fisher's career.

did.unittitle: Mike Fisher with politicians, comstituents, and others
Kent Gates with politicians and a Regan headshot
Specter, Ridge, Schweiker, and Rendell photos

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Miscellaneous subseries consists of a variety of Fisher photographs. Included are pictures with important political figures, as well as headshots of the politicians. There are personal photographs as well.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Audio-Visual Material series is comprised of VHS and betacam cassette tapes of commercials, debates, interviews, and other materials created during the Fisher for Governor campaign. The vast majority of the commercials were created by the advertising firm, BrabenderCox. Three VHS cassettes fall outside the scope of the Fisher gubernatorial campaign, these are: a Joseph Kohn/Preate debate from October 1992 (2 tapes) and an October 1996 tape from the Black Attorneys Association candidates forum. The CDs were created by Fisher for Governor campaign staff and includes a BrabenderCox commercial, a database, press documents, local elected officials. Staff files are comprised of files created by Deputy Finance Directors Kristen Clark and Sarah Rajca; Policy Director David Sumner; and Research Director Ray Zaborney. The staff files contain emails, event information, form letters, fundraising information, information on opponents, issue research and talking points, memoranda, photographs, speeches, strategy and planning information.
